channel.title: Splunk Synthetics on Splunk Observability Cloud Workshops
channel.description: Recent content in Splunk Synthetics on Splunk Observability Cloud Workshops

item.title: 1. Synthetics Dashboard
item.description: Go to Synthetics Your instructor will highlight which Synthetic test to use Click on the test Note: be aware of screenshot for this step Change to last hour In Splunk Observability Cloud from the main menu, click on Synthetics. Click on All or Browser test to see the list of active tests: This view has already been covered in the short introduction earlier. To continue, select the Workshop Browser Test for [NAME OF WORKSHOP] from the Test Pane.

item.title: 2. Synthetics Test Detail
item.description: Deep dive into a must be successful and long run duration Walk through, screenshots, video and highlight Synthetic vs RUM Web Vitals, Business Transactions, Waterfall, etc. 5 steps/business trans We know there is an issue placing orders, so click on place Order Find POST checkout and click APM link Right now we are looking at the result of a single Synthetic Browser Test. This test is split up in multiple Synthetic transactions, think of this of a group of one or more logically related interactions that represent a business-critical user flow.

item.title: 3. Synthetics to APM
item.description: We now should have a view similar to the one below. Exercise In the waterfall find the second call out to POST checkout. Click on the > button on front of it to drop open the MetaData section. Verify that the credit card information is passed to the service. Close the Meta Data view and confirm you havre the same view as above. Click on the blue ðŸ”—APM link behind the checkout line in the waterfall Exercise Make sure you are in an APM trace view Validate you see errors, where we got the failure in the payment service To verify, its the same error er sre seeing, click on related content log link Repeat the exercise to filter down to errors only View the error log to validate the failed payment due to invalid Token.

item.title: 4. Synthetics Detector
item.description: Given you can run these tests 24/7, it is an ideal tool to get warned early if your test are failing or starting to run longer then your agreed SLA instead of getting informed by social media, or Uptime web site’s. To stop that from happening lets detect if our test are taking more then 1.1 minute. Exercise Go back to Synthetics home page via the Menu on the left Select the workshop test again and click the Create Detector button at the top of the page.
